title: Indian Railways To Go Single-Use Plastic-Free From Gandhi Jayanti This Year
text:
In a much needed step, the Ministry of Railways has decided to enforce a ban on single-use plastic materials on its premises including the trains. The step will be in effect from October 2, 2019 (Gandhi Jayanti).

The Railway Board has asked Indian Railways Catering and Tourism Development Corporation (IRCTC) to implement return of plastic drinking bottles. They are also ready to install 1.853 plastic bottle crushing machines at 360 major stations in the first phase.

Indian Railways will be the first major organisation to ban single use plastic material from October, 2nd. #EnvironmentalConservation #EnvironmentalProtectionNeededhttps://t.co/OanwCU5S3q — Western Railway (@WesternRly) August 21, 2019

General Managers of Zonal Railways and Production Units were told to encourage all railways vendors to avoid the use of plastic carry bags. Railway employees were also advised to reduce, reuse and refuse plastic products and to use inexpensive reusable bags to reduce plastic footprint.

Indian Railways was identified as a 'waste generator' and had to take adequate steps to follow Plastic Waste Management rules, a Railway Board officer said. Accordingly, steps should be taken to minimise the generation of plastic waste and for its eco-friendly disposal.
